title: Thread state management: focused/active/frozen
description:
Implement thread state management to limit concurrent Claude sessions:

**States:**
- focused: 1 thread max, currently has attention
- active: 3 threads max, Claude running in tmux
- frozen: unlimited, session on disk only (no tmux window)

**Behavior:**
- When new thread needs focus and active >= 3, freeze oldest active (kill tmux window, keep session-id)
- Focused thread moves to active when another thread takes focus
- Frozen threads can resume later with same session-id (Claude persists state)

**Changes needed:**
- Add ThreadState to Thread type
- Add session-id persistence to Thread (for resume)
- Add state transition logic in attention/executive
- Add cleanup for old frozen threads (age-based pruning?)
- Update tmux window management to support freeze/resume

title: Evaluate signal_done vs CPU activity for session detection
description:
Compare the effectiveness of two approaches for detecting when Claude is done thinking:
1. MCP signal_done tool - Claude explicitly signals completion
2. CPU activity monitoring - Watch process CPU usage for idle detection

Need to measure: reliability, latency, false positives/negatives. The CPU approach is a fallback but may be more reliable since it doesn't depend on Claude remembering to call signal_done.
